intro: Siphocampylus yerbalensis, commonly known as the Yerbalensis siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes a variety of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are characterized by their pale blue to violet coloration and are often clustered in racemes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
